"File List" Widget
The "Files List" Widget is used for displaying files (documents) attached to the System object.
Example of a customized widget:
Before you start customizing the widget, create a new
entity
and proceed with creating instances for this object type
The “File List” widget can be configured in the
visual edit mode
. To do this, find the widget in the corresponding list in the "Elements" window and place it on the workspace.
Widget settings
Widget setup involves filling in the following parameters:
Setting
Purpose
Attribute with files
Selecting an object attribute of the System object that stores the attached files.
Show classifications
Selecting a file classification to display.
Title text
Entering a title text of the file display area (optional). By default, it takes over the name of the attribute with files.
Text of the button "Show all"
Entering the button name text (optional). By default, the "Show All" text is displayed.
Setting example
In this example, the
"Attach files"
visual attribute is used as an
attribute with files
. The settings also indicate that the widget will display files related to classifications: All files; Other; System files.
All files;
Other;
System files.
The widget title text is "Files", it is entered manually. Similarly with the "Show all" button text.
Once the setting up completed, the user will preview the widget.
Now save the visual settings. After adding new documents to the object attribute for storing files, they will automatically be displayed in the “File List” widget.
Attached documents can be downloaded using the
button located opposite the file.
The "Show All" button, whose text can be overridden in the widget settings, is displayed only if the object attribute visual has a visual to work with files, displaying a certain number of files per page (for example, the "Files attached for signing" attribute visual).
